title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 4055/89 of 19 December 1989 fixing catch possibilities for 1990 for certain fish stocks and groups of fish stocks in the regulatory area as defined in the NAFO convention
header:
COUNCIL REGULATION (EEC) N° 4055/89 of 19 December 1989 fixing catch  possibilities for 1990 for certain fish stocks and groups of fish stocks in the Regulatory Area as  defined in the NAFO Convention
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Catches in 1990 of the species set out in Annex I by vessels flying the flag of a  Member State in the Regulatory Area as defined in Article 1 (2) of the NAFO Convention shall be  limited, within the parts of the Regulatory Area referred to in that Annex, to the quotas set out  therein.

In addition to complying with Articles 5, 6, 7 and 8 of Regulation (EEC) N° 2241/87,  skippers shall enter in the logbook the information listed in Annex II.
In complying with Article 9 of that Regulation, Member States shall also inform the Commission of  catches of species not subject to quota.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 January 1990.
It shall apply until 31 December 1990.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all  Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 19 December 1989.
For the CouncilThe PresidentJ. MELLICK
(1)OJ N° L 24, 27. 1. 1983, p. 1.
(2)OJ N° L 378, 31. 12. 1978, p. 1.
(3)OJ N° L 207, 29. 7. 1987, p. 1.
(4)OJ N° L 306, 11. 11. 1988, p. 2.
(5)OJ N° L 175, 6. 7. 1988, p. 1.
